drupalNodeEvent.title: Book Talk - Hybrid Modernity: The Public Park in Late 20th Century China

field_organizers.processed: Urban China Zoom (sponsored by Harvard Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies, MIT Sustainable Urbanization Lab)

field_description.processed: Hybrid Modernity navigates away from the dichotomous western binary discourse of comparing China to the western world and recognizes China as a long-standing world civilization with its own unique societal and continuous evolution. Dr. Padua’s talk will touch on: modernization and nation-building; historical notions of China’s modernity and revolutionary praxis; cultural trends “inside” and “outside” post-Mao China; and the rise of China’s secondary cities as living laboratories for design innovation, legacy-building and political ambitions. Dr. Padua’s talk will focus on ways the four purpose-built public parks represent the schema for post-Mao China’s hybrid modern design genre. Dr. Padua will also speculate on the shift from China’s late 20th century “hybrid modernization” and Deng’s “growth first” unregulated development to China’s 21st century “ecological modernization."
